thread.title: Drue Heinz, a Restless Philanthropist, Provided Refuge for Poets and Literary Novelists

author: James R. Hagerty
title: Drue Heinz, a Restless Philanthropist, Provided Refuge for Poets and Literary Novelists
text:
Drue Heinz’s insomnia was a blessing for struggling writers. When the wife of Henry John “Jack” Heinz II couldn’t sleep, she read novels, cultivating a devotion to the written word that made her a benefactor of novelists and poets.
She... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
